question.title: Is there a way to extend an interface with Jakarta endpoints as a Quarkus Rest Client without adding any additional endpoints?
question.body:
I'm trying to create and Inject a RestClient interface into my Quarkus application. This rest client interface extends another interface from an external library where all my endpoints are configured. I am on Quarkus 3 and am using the quarkus-rest-client-reactive-jackson library.

This is the rest client

@Path("path/path")
@RegisterRestClient(configKey = "my-service")
public interface IMyRestService extends IServiceEndpoints {
}

This is the external interface

@Path("path/path")
public interface IServiceEndpoints{
    
    @POST
    @Path("")
    @Consumes({"text/plain"})
    @Produces({"text/plain"})
    String doAction(String description);

    <more endpoints>
}

When I try to run this, I get a unsatisfied dependency build error. I can solve this error by implementing an endpoint in my rest client layer. I was wondering if there's a way to fix this error without having to add an (in my case nonsensical) endpoint to my rest client. I know ideally that I would just put endpoints into the rest client without the library layer, but that's not how this project is structured unfortunately.
